description: The round payoff this round was 1. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -1000.

The game is a version of a coordination versus defection dilemma where if one player opts for the “risky” option 2 while the other sticks with option 1, the defector gains the round input (a positive payoff) whereas the opponent suffers an equivalent negative payoff; however, if both choose option 2 they incur a heavy penalty (the round input multiplied by 1000)—this creates a sharp risk–reward trade‐off.

Even though Deepseek-R1 (Kate) is known to default to option 1, the record from 2024-01-02 shows that she chose option 2 when John did too, leading both to a significant loss; this suggests that Kate’s strategy may adapt based on insights from the shared API, rather than rigidly following a preset default.

The fact that both players have access to each other’s APIs introduces an extra strategic layer, meaning that actions might be influenced by knowledge of the opponent’s tendencies or even anticipated moves—which makes deviation from default play potentially exploitable and risky
